Articles.Content: I noticed in the debug menu there is an option to turn off crash damage. I designed a large rover that I simply can not land safely. If I turn on the cheatcode and then drop my rover at 10k ft, will it blow up or will it be unbreakable?
It just makes the parts really really strong, it does not make them unbreakable.
So I cant just aim at the Mun, turn it on, go eat a sandwich and then come back to find a fully functional rover ready for playtime. Doh!
No. A full speed Mun crash is just that. You'd be hitting it at a minimum of a thousand m/s. Even no crash damage can't save you from that.

ive turned on unbreakable joints before and have had a rocket shake itself apart. and ya, what Sierra above me said is right, even with such cheats on, you plow into any body at orbital velocity or faster you will explode, they physics of the impact will over run the 'cheat'
